page.title: 06CHILDRENS' GAMES
page.content: Hop-scotch is a school game because courts are needed. Tallyo has two teams and is a hide and seek game, using a wall as a 'block' to free your team-mates. Infants make up games like "Star Wars", "Superman" and others. "Spotlight" shines a torch on your opponent at night and they try to catch someone else. Kick-the-can and Whip-and-Top used to be popular. Cricket and Football are popular among boys. Infants (not Juniors) play Chasey instead. Indoors, board games and computers interest both boys and girls. The girls like rounders. Kingo involves throwing a ball at someone in a circle, then the person hit shouts 'Kingo!' and everyone stops while they throw the ball. Queenie involves passing a ball behind your back and guessing who has it. Bulldog is a rough team game trying to pass a mark.
